fields_of_interest: Trade, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
PowerShift does awareness raising and lobby work on  
-> EU trade policy  
-> EU International Investment Policy 
-> EU Raw Materials Policy (Conflict Minerals, etc.) 
 
We also follow EU Energy policy.
organisation_name: PowerShift - Verein fuer eine oekologisch-solidarische Energie- & Weltwirtschaft e.V. (PowerShift)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
PowerShift is a member of: 
- BER (Berliner Entwicklungspolitischer Ratschlag) 
- Berlin Global Village e.V. (non profit association aiming at creating a 'One world house' in Berlin) 
- AG Handel im Forum Umwelt & Entwicklung (Working Group on Trade in German NGO Forum Environment & Development) 
- TTIPUnfairhandelbar (http://www.ttip-unfairhandelbar.de/) 
- Seattle to Brussels-Network (www.s2bnetwork.org) 
- CorA. Corporate Accountability - German Network on Corporate Responsibility (www.cora-netz.de) 
- and of attac (Germany Network) 
 
and in addition we work in various informal networks with other NGOs and trade unions (on trade, raw materials and energy-related issues). We coordinate the German NGO-coalition working on Resource Politics/Raw Materials (AK Rohstoffe).
legal_status: gemeinnuetziger Verein / Non-Profit Association (under German Law)
goals__remit:
On the basis of the ethical concepts of 'climate justice' and 'resource justice' PowerShift contributes to a more sustainable, socially and ecologically fair economic system (including a more sustainable energy system) in Germany, Europe and internationally. 
PowerShift works on awareness-raising, research, educational work, campaigning and lobby activities around issues such as 'trade and environment', 'climate change and trade', 'investment policy for sustainable development', 'renewable energy', 'raw materials/natural resources', and 'sustainable energy for all'. In networks and campaigns we work together with like-minded NGOs, trade unions and academics from Berlin (our current centre of activity), Germany, Europe and other countries.
